head.title: Finance/New Issues; GMAC in Pricing Of 8.75% Notes

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Finance/New Issues; GMAC in Pricing Of 8.75% Notes

block.p: LEAD: The General Motors Acceptance Corporation yesterday priced $300 million of 8.75 percent notes due in 1995 at a price of 99.649 to yield 8.84 percent through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation.

LEAD: The General Motors Acceptance Corporation yesterday priced $300 million of 8.75 percent notes due in 1995 at a price of 99.649 to yield 8.84 percent through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation.

The General Motors Acceptance Corporation yesterday priced $300 million of 8.75 percent notes due in 1995 at a price of 99.649 to yield 8.84 percent through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation.
Underwriters said the yield spread over Treasury securities with a similar maturity is 66 basis points. A basis point is one-hundredth of a percentage point.
Noncallable for life, the notes are rated A-3 by Moody's and AA- by Standard & Poor's.
